TI RETRACTED: Intelligent Manufacturing system based on machining features
   and its application (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE design features; machining features; intelligent manufacturing; feature
   recognition
AB Intelligent manufacturing is an orientation in the future manufacturing. In order to achieve this goal, the integration of CAD/CAM systems is the key. However, feature technology, which is regarded as a medium of information transmission in the integration of CAD/CAM systems, is expected the critical technology between the design and manufacturing environment. To simplify the manufacturing process and improve its efficiency, an intelligent manufacturing system based on machining features is presented in this paper. The key technologies related to the intelligent manufacturing, including feature recognition, machining operations based on machining features, knowledge-based machining database, are discussed respectively. The detailed implementation of the intelligent manufacturing system is also used to illustrate the superiority of the intelligent manufacturing than the commonly-used one. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Reach on Service-oriented Coverage Testing Approach
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Service-oriented architecture; service-oriented coverage testing;
   coverage adequacy criteria; testable services
AB The emerging paradigm of service-oriented architecture is increasingly popular and powerful that is its flexibility, high dynamism and loose coupling. However, oriented-services pose new and difficult challenges to external testers, because it just provides a WSDL interface for test. It is not sufficient to understand quality of integration among application and independent web services. To address this limitation, some researchers have proposed a novel methodology, namely SOCT (service-oriented coverage testing). This is a notion of coverage testing to the service-oriented application that makes web services more transparent. In this paper, upon the basic of introduced SOCT, we improve the coverage testing framework by using the testing coverage analyzer (TCA) which can calculate coverage measures for supplying a gap to TCov service (only records and retrieves the coverage information) and adding a services pool convenient for testable services collection. Finally we illustrate a case study of ticket reservation system that applies SOCT approach to BPEL (business process execution language) process. The results of this study reveal the testability and feasibility of this approach and attract more and more interested pursuers to investigate it. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Pan, Wenjuan; Li, Xinke] HeFei Univ Technol Hefei, Dept Comp & Informat, Hefei, Anhui, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Remediation of Substantial Hexavalent Chromium-contaminated
   Soil by Washing with EDTA Solution (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Chromium(VI); Soil washing; EDTA; Complexation
ID HEAVY-METALS
AB The remediation of soil contaminated with substantial hexavalent chromium was studied by soil washing with EDTA. It was effective for the removal of hexavalent chromium from soil. In this study, the influence of reaction time, ratio of soil and liquid, concentration of EDTA solution and pH were all discussed. The conditions of remediation of Cr (VI) were optimized. The results indicated that 5 minutes was optimum reaction time. When the concentration of EDTA solution was 0.01mol/l, the removal was up to the maximum (83.49%). However, if the concentration continued to add up, the Cr (VI) removal efficiency would not increase with the concentration. When the ratio was 1:40, 92.75% Cr (VI) was washed from soil, rising to the peak. But the removal slightly decreased when the ratio rose to 1:50. The effect of pH of EDTA solution on Cr (VI) removal was not very obvious. So, the pH was elected at 6.53. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Pang, Bo; Zhang, Huanzhen; Li, Fei; Chen, Shuifei] China Univ Geosci, Sch Water Resources & Environm, Xueyuan Rd 29th, Beijing 100083, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Study on Operating Effect for Different Influent Mode of
   Anaerobic Baffled Reactor (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Anaerobic baffled reactor; Divisional influent; Hydraulic retention
   time; Organic loading
ID SHOCK LOADS; PERFORMANCE; ABR; STEP
AB The performance of a laboratory scale divisional influent anaerobic baffled reactor (DI-ABR) was studied, which adopted four spots and three spots influent, in order to prevent volatile fatty acids (VFA) from accumulating overly that which is brought by high organic loading in the first compartment, and compared with single influent anaerobic baffled reactor (SI-ABR) under the different conditions of the hydraulic retention time (HRT) and organic loading. The experimental results showed that the difference of microorganism was very apparent between DI-ABR and SI-ABR, the most microorganism in DI-ABR was hydrolysis-acidification bacteria, the divisional influent could increase the function of hydrolysis and acidification, and the COD removal rate of DI-ABR was improved about 5%similar to 10% as compared to SI-ABR through adjusting properly operating parameter and influent manner for different wastewater, the effluent B/C value of DI-ABR was up to 56%. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Peng Ju-wei; Han Xiang-kui; Wang Hong-zhe] Jilin Architectural & Civil Engn Inst, Changchun 130021, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Determination of 1-Naphthylamine by Flow Injection
   Chemiluminescence (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Flow injection chemiluminescence; Potassium permanganate;
   1-Naphthylamine; Formaldehyde
ID PESTICIDE NAPTALAM; CHROMATOGRAPHY; WATER
AB Chemiluminescence reaction of 1-naphthylamine (NAP) with potassium permanganate in the presence of formaldehyde as an enhancer was investigated. A new chemiluminescence (CL) method for the determination of 1-naphthylamine with flow injection technique was developed. The linear range for 1-naphthylamine is 5.0x10(-8)-8.0x10(-5)mol/L with a detection limit of 7.6x10(-9) mol/L, and the relative standard deviation (n=11) is 3.6%. The method has been used to determine the content of 1-naphthylamine in real water with satisfactory results. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Ping, Yu; Dong, Wang] Shenyang Ligong Univ, Sch Environm & Chem Engn, Shenyang 110159, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Operating Variables in Chemical Extraction of Heavy metals
   from Contaminated Soils (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE soil washing; heavy metals; chelating agents; ultrasonic
ID EDTA; LEAD
AB Heavy metals contamination in soils is widespread across the world, and the remediation of these soils is a difficult task. One possible technique for remediation of soils contaminated by heavy metals is soil washing using chelating agents. Ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid (EDTA) and Citric acid (CA) are very effective chelating agents for this purpose. The aim of this study is to investigate the optimum conditions for extraction of Cu, Pb, Ni, Zn and Cd considering tow factors-contact time and pH value and to evaluate the possibility of ultrasonic extraction as potential alternatives compared with oscillation for speedy. With the increase of molar ratio (chelating agents/heavy metal), the amounts of heavy metals extracted from these artificial contaminated soils increased. A ratio of 10 between chelating agents and the heavy metal is required for a higher extraction rate no matter the agent is EDTA or CA. Experiments showed for all heavy metals that acidity was benefit for extraction. A higher removal efficiency was easily achieved at a pH value of 3 similar to 4. Extractions of metals reached satisfactory efficiency in a relatively short time by ultrasonic compared with that by oscillation. In apply of soil washing for soils contaminated by heavy metals, the use of ultrasonic has a great potential to achieve rapid extraction purposes. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Qi, Jingxian; Wang, Heli; Sun, Huichao; Shen, Liang; Lian, Xinying] China Univ Geosci, Sch Water Resource & Environm, Beijing 100083, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: A steganographic scheme for 3D point cloud models (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE steganography; 3D point cloud models; self-similarity patch chain;
   spatial domain
ID COMPRESSION
AB This paper presents a new steganographic scheme for 3D point cloud models using self-similarity segmentation. The new scheme segments the 3D point cloud model to patches using self-similarity measures, and generates the codebook. The representative patches and similar patches are then taken from the codebook for every similar patch chain as the reference patches and the message patches. Finally, every message point in the similar message patches which has the point-to-point correspondence with a certain reference point in the reference patch can embed at least three bits by shifting the message point from current point to the corresponding embedding position using space subdivision. Experimental results show that the proposed technique is secure, has high capacity and low distortion, and is robust against uniform affine transformations such as transformation, rotation, scaling. The technique can be considered as a side-match steganography and has proven to be a feasible alternative to other steganographic schemes for 3D point cloud model. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Qi Ke; Xie Dong-qing] Guangzhou Univ, Sch Comp Sci & Educ Software, Guangzhou 510006, Guangdong, Peoples R China.
RP Qi, K (reprint author), Guangzhou Univ, Sch Comp Sci & Educ Software, Guangzhou 510006, Guangdong, Peoples R China.
EM qikersa@163.com

TI RETRACTED: Digital Evidence Protection Model with Batch-verifying and
   Public Verifiability for Computer Forensics (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE cryptography; computer forensics; batch signing; public verifiability;
   message integrity
AB The traditional integrity protection of evidence currently available only accounts for the entire time between seizure and presentation. Few people focus their eyes on the time before seizure. Here, through analyzing in detail the relation between digital evidence and intrusion process, a digital evidence protection model with batch-verifying and public verifiability is proposed to protect the generated digital evidence in time. The new protection model can reasonably account for the entire time between generation and presentation. The digital evidence based on the new model is valid and acceptable. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Qi, Zhao-Hui; Gao, Zhan-Feng; Shen, Ying-Ming; Han, Bing-Xin] Shijiazhuang Tiedao Univ, Coll Informat Sci & Technol, Shijiazhuang 050043, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Study of Environmental Impact of Borax Production Process
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE borax; Compression to alkaline degradation method; Alkali carbonate
   method; Environmental management; LCA
AB Study the situation of environmental impact in borax's production process,(compression to alkaline degradation method and alkali carbonate method). Improves and perfects the AT&T matrix system evaluation method, contrasting borax's production process (compression to alkaline degradation method and alkali carbonate method), and outlines the legend of the corresponding factor (stage)-environmental effects. Result shows that the life-cycle analysis based on the framework of LCA is a practical analysis theory of resources utility and environmental management. Actively explore the leading technical path of borax's preparation using alkali carbonate method, and taking into account compression to alkaline degradation method as borax industrial ecological technology, would be more directional approach to solve boron industrial resources and environmental problems. TI RETRACTED: TCPW-AA: An Enhanced TCP Protocol for Hybrid Networks
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE TCP Westwood; TIBET; Heterogeneous Networks; Bandwidth Estimation;
   Efficiency and Friendliness; simulation
AB In this paper, we propose an enhanced TCP protocol aiming at improving efficiency in heterogeneous networks while maintaining friendliness to existing protocols, such as NewReno. This scheme, named TCPW-AA, uses the idea of congestion control algorithm in TCP-Westwood and a totally different bandwidth estimation method based on an unbiased technique TIBET. We make some improvement to achieve good tradeoff between efficiency and friendliness. Simulations on ns2 and comparisons with TCPW, TIBET and NewReno show its advantages and effectiveness. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Study on the Adsorption of Nitrobenzene from Aqueous Solution
   by Inorgano-Organo-Montmorillonites (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE norgano-organo-montmorillonites; Adsorption; Nitrobenzene; Kinetic;
   Thermodynamics
ID SORPTION; WATER
AB On condition that OH-/Al3+ molar ration was 2.4, inorgano and inorgano -organo- montmorillonites was synthesized by titrating Na-montmorillonite with hydroxyl aluminum solution. From powder XRD data, it was shown that the interlayer of montmorillonites was increased to 1.9 nm and over. The adsorption of nitrobenzene by four modified montmorillonite samples was also studied and the results showed that the adsorbability of inorgano-organo-montmorillonites was much better than Na-montmorillonites. The adsorption dynamics follows the laws of Bangham and Langmuir. The relation between adsorbing quantity(q(e)) and equilibrium concentration (C-e) tallies with the isothermal adsorption equations of Freundlich and Langmuir. The adsorption is presented by heat evolution physisorption and organic partion. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Comprehensive Evaluation on Air Quality of Ro-Ro Ship Cabins
   Based on Grey Matter Elements Analysis (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Grey matter elements analysis; Comprehensive evaluation; Ro-ro ship;
   In-cabin air quality
AB In-cabin air quality may affect the health of people on board ship to a great extent. Common methodologies to assess indoor air quality include index evaluation method, fuzzy comprehensive assessment method, grey correlation analysis method, etc. In this study, several main air pollutants in cabins of different classes of six ro-ro ships are measured and analyzed; a questionnaire survey about warm feeling, humidity, air quality, sanitary condition is carried out to the passengers. By adopting grey matter elements analysis and mathematics statistics, in-cabin air quality is integrated evaluated according to the detecting results and the results of questionnaire survey. The integrated evaluation results point out: air quality of the fifth class cabins is the poorest in all cabins investigated. Finally, a few control methods and suggestions have been brought forward to improve the in-cabin air quality. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Implementation of Visual Simulation Training System of
   Artillery Radar (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Visual simulation; Artillery radar; Azimuth calibration; Model
AB In order to deal with the difficulties in the azimuth calibration training of some type artillery radar, such as limited training field, serious radar loss and expensive training outlay, a training simulator system of artillery radar azimuth calibration is realized based on scene simulation technologies. Composition structure, function module and key technologies of the system are discussed first. This system is then developed with tools of Multigen-Creator, Vega, VC++6.0, and a living virtual battlefield environment is created. The system possesses the functions of battlefield scene display, azimuth calibration training and training result evaluation. At last the simulation pictures are listed, the results show that the simulation system simulates the azimuth calibration operation process of artillery radar livingly and can meet the requirements of real time simulation. TI RETRACTED: Soil Heavy Metal Pollution Evaluation using Grey Relational
   Analysis (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Grey Theory; Relational Analysis; Evaluation on Heavy Metal Pollution
AB In gray system theory, Grey relational analysis is very important. In this paper this method was applied in the soil heavy metal pollution. firstly, the study makes it possible to apply the grey relational analysis model to the reliability analysis of environmental impact assessment of regional area. Secondly we proved by the research that grey relational analysis is suitable for evaluation on soil heavy metal pollution due to its simple calculation and good operability, and evaluation results conform to real conditions. The results show that the grey relational analysis method will reduce the calculation of environmental quality to some extent. In this paper, we made the conclusion that the method of grey relational analysis is a very useful optimizing method for the soil heavy metal pollution. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Research on the intelligent process planning technology based
   on STEP-NC (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE STEP-NC; Intelligent Machining; Process Planning; Neural networks; Fuzzy
   logic
AB STEP-NC has the characteristics of workingsteps, which can be used easily in the intelligent CNC machining system. Based on the characteristics of STEP-NC data structure, an intelligent process planning system is presented in this paper. Geometric information translation, feature information extraction, process planning, STEP-NC file generation are all involved. The lexical analysis of the AP203 files, and the translation from AP203 to geometric information database are also studied. The proposed system maps a STEP AP224 data file, without using a complex feature recognition process, and produces the corresponding machining operations to generate the process plan and the corresponding STEP-NC file. The system carries out several stages of process planning such as operations selection, tool selection, machining parameters determination, machine tools selection and setup planning. A hybrid approach of most recent techniques (neural networks, fuzzy logic and rule-based) of artificial intelligence is used as the inference engine of the developed system. An example part is tested and the corresponding process plan is presented to demonstrate and verify the proposed intelligent CAPP system. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Ouyang Hua-bing] Tongji Univ, Dept Mech Engn, Shanghai 200092, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: The fuzzy comprehensive evaluation method based on improved
   super-standard weight (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE fuzzy comprehensive evaluation; membership; super-standard weight; fuzzy
   composite operator
AB Weights identifying and fuzzy composite operator selection are two key technologies of the fuzzy comprehensive evaluation. Super-standard weight has been widely used in the water quality evaluation and environmental assessment. However, the super-standard weight present determination methods are related to the introduced comparison base point. And the linear super-standard weight does not reflect that the fluctuation of the index value near the critical point of the classification will lead to a wrong judgement. And the S-type super-standard weight is associated with the human psychology. So it is difficult to grasp. In this paper the super-standard weight determination method was improved for the shortcomings of the present methods, and it's proposed that super-standard weight was determined by membership. At last, the fuzzy composite operator matched with super-standard weight was decided. And actual examples demonstrated the improved fuzzy comprehensive evaluation method had good performance. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Study on Biological Aerated Filter as Enhanced Pretreatment
   Process of Coagulation and Sedimentation (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE BAF; coagulation and sedimentation; pretreatment; circulating cooling
   water; secondary effluent
AB Using coagulation and sedimentation process in the advanced treatment of urban secondary effluent which can be recycled to circulating cooling water system in power plant is only perform well on CODCr and turbidity removal. But the concentrations of organic matter and NH3 in effluent can not meet the requirements of circulating cooling water. Therefore, in this study, the feasibility of biological aerated filter (BAF) as a pretreatment enhancing coagulation and sedimentation process was discussed. Achieved by controlling the two operating modes: (1) secondary effluent -> coagulation and sedimentation -> effluent; (2) secondary effluent -> BAF -> coagulation and sedimentation -> effluent. The results show that the BAF pretreatment removes ammonia nitrogen effectively, and the turbidity and CODCr of effluent of BAF-coagulation sedimentation process is much lower than individual coagulation and sedimentation process. The final effluent qualities meet the requirements of circulating cooling water system in power plant. And the flocculant's dosage is effectively reduced. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Shen, Liang; Wang, Heli; Qi, Jingxian; Lian, Xinying; Sun, Huichao] China Univ Geosci, Sch Water Resource & Environm, Beijing 100083, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: A multicore scheduling algorithm considering cache warm-up
   overheads (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE real-time systems; scheduling algorithm; cache warm-up overheads
AB With the development of multicore architectures, multicore real-time scheduling has become a hot topic. Cache warm-up overheads introduced by task migration between two cores lead to some tasks miss deadlines in time-critical systems. In this paper, we propose a scheduling algorithm based on push-assisted model, which is a hardware mechanism used to proactive migrate cache lines of tasks. Our scheduling algorithm provides software support for proactive migration. It is shown that our algorithm is effective in some examples. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Implementing Autonomous Control for Mixed Model Production
   Systems using Wireless Sensor/Actuator Networks (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE mixed-model production; autonomous control; wireless sensor/actuator
   network
AB In mixed model production, autonomous control method, which has been proved more responsive, robust and adaptive, is proposed to cope with rising complexity and dynamics. However, the implementation of autonomous control method is still a challenge. This paper focuses on implementing autonomous mixed model production control with wireless sensor/actuator networking technologies. The system architectures and design issues of wireless sensor/actuator network for autonomous mixed production control are presented, and a case study on which experiments are being made with an autonomous control application prototype shows its feasibility. TI RETRACTED: Framework Construction of Traffic Environmental Monitoring
   and Early-Warning System (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE traffic safety; traffic environmental safety; environmental monitoring;
   early-warning system
AB In order to establish the traffic environmental monitoring and early-warning system, which is the important groundwork for the environmental protection and traffic safety system, theories and methods of auto-monitoring and alarming were used in the paper. Firstly, the existing problems of traffic environmental monitoring and early-warning were analyzed in this paper, then the framework of traffic environmental monitoring and early-warning system was constructed, which was composed of four sub-systems: the foundation support system, the technical support system, the environmental management system and the public participation system. The establishment of traffic environmental monitoring and early-warning system can fully reflect the environmental quality and change trends, track timely the changes of pollution emission, as accurately as possible alarm and respond to all kinds of environmental emergencies in time, meet the needs of traffic environmental management and safety management. TI RETRACTED: Applicat(a)ion of Support Vector Regression in Network
   Performance Evaluation (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Support Vector Regression; Evaluation; Network performance; Grid
AB It is well-known that network performance evaluation is very important for safe and stable using of computer network. Support vector regression is applied to evaluate network performance in the paper. The parameters in the support vector regression model have a great influence on the evaluation ability of support vector regression model. Grid is applied to select the optimal combination of the parameters of support vector regression model. In order to testify the superiority of support vector regression evaluation model for network performance compared with the traditional evaluation methods such as BP neural network. The testing results indicate that the network evaluation model based on support vector regression has better evaluation performance than BP neural network. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Risk assessment of the mine environment information based on
   multi-sensor information fusion (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE neural network fusion; risk assessment; multi-sensor information fusion
AB In recent years China's frequent mine incidents, the scene of the accident left a lot of information and the remnants of environmental information, with mine difficult after coal mine accident dangerous environment of many characteristics, based on multi-sensor information fusion (MSF) of the coal mine environment Risk assessment of the new algorithm, which adopts BP neural network algorithm and establishes model of coal mine environmental information risk of neural network model predicted the three-layer back propagation neural network, the neural network to connect the entire network structure is 5 x 12 x 5, the five input variables are the H2S (%), temperature (degrees C), wind speed (m / s), methane (%), CO (%), the five output value is the level of security. The simulation experiments show that the model can accurately assess environmental risk coal mine the extent of the model and can verify the effectiveness and feasibility. The application result shows that the prediction with this method can achieve higher better utility and expensive value. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Environment Policy: Tighten or Loosen?-A case study of China
   textile and clothing industry (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Environment policy; International competitiveness of industry;
   Environmental protection stringency; Coefficient
AB Does a much strict environment policy do good or harm to the economy, especially to a export-oriented country like China. Taking the textile and clothing industry for example, this paper analyzes the industry competitiveness via TC and RCA, and establishes an estimative index system of the intensity of environmental protection - EPS. By determining the coefficients between EPS and TC or RCA of China Textile and clothing industry, finally it shows that there is no regular relation between the intensity of environmental protection and the international competitiveness of the industry. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Key Technologies of Statistical Mapping Based on RIA
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011

LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)

SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Online Thematic Map; RIA; Active; Knowledge
AB This paper analyzes two important problems of online thematic map cartography facing, namely which technique solution is appropriate and how to simplify the cartography process. Firstly, contrasts some popular technique solutions of thematic map, and points out the bottlenecks and inconveniences of thematic map cartography process nowadays, then brings out active online thematic map cartography based on the technique solution of RIA (Rich Internet Applications). In addition, this paper gives out RIA-based implementation framework of active online thematic maps mapping, which is contrasted with RIA-based implementation framework of general online thematic maps mapping, and main methods of building knowledge of active cartography of thematic map. TI RETRACTED: Design and Research of Detecting Equipment of the Bogie
   Wheelset Alignment Parameters for Railway Vehicles (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE railway vehicle; bogie; wheelset; wheelbase difference; diagonal
   difference; alignment parameter
AB In view of weak points of low precision, single test items, and inability in measuring wheelset diagonal difference, detecting equipment of bogie wheelset alignment parameters for railway vehicle could not meet the technique demands of high-speed trains. Four virtual prototypes of wheelset alignment parameters detecting equipment are described, which can measure wheelbase difference and diagonal difference with the same equipment. The methods of wheel center direct measurement and indirect measurement are used. As the main measuring instruments, grating encoder and laser distance meter can detect more precisely. The Device of Wheel Center Positioning Fixture Integrated with Grating Encoder complies with the request of bogie manufacturer after comparison of four designed equipment prototypes, because of satisfied precision and reasonable price. Besides, measurement and control system and database of detecting equipment of bogie wheelset alignment parameters are designed. The research provides a theoretical basis for the bogie design and structure improvement. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Su Lili] Jilin Univ, State Key Lab Automot Dynam Simulat, Changchun 130025, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Development of Frequency and Power Control System
   Hardware-in-loop Simulation Platform for Ship Power Plant (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Ship power plant; Hardware-in-loop Simulation; frequency and power
   controller
ID THE-LOOP
AB In order to research the dynamic and static performance of ship power plant, the status quo of frequency and power control are analyzed. A hardware-in-loop simulator was built based on LabVIEW platform and Programmable Logic Controller (PLC), and the hardware-in-loop simulations were performed for frequency and power control in ship power plant. Before choosing the frequency and power controller, the value of the deviation of the real load from the desired load is basically big, diesel error is 39.5%, and turbine error is 19.5%. When controller is adopted, diesel error is 12.8%, and turbine error is 5.3%. The experiment results show the platform provides a new effective method for development of the frequency and power control, because of its merit such as shortening lead time and saving development funds. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental

TI RETRACTED: Economic/environmental dispatch for wind-thermal power system
   using a multi-objective differential evolution algorithm (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Environmental/economic dispatch; wind power; differential evolution;
   entropy weight
AB With consideration of the increased costs for maintaining power system stable due to the incorporation of wind power, in this paper, an economic/environmental dispatch stochastic optimization model for power system integrated with large scale wind farms was formulated based on in-depth analysis of the random nature and probability calculations of overestimation and underestimation of available wind power output. The optimization goals are to minimize both the total polluting emission and operational cost as much as possible. An excellent multi-objective optimization algorithm based on the non-dominated sorting differential evolution was proposed to solve this model, and entropy weights and fuzzy set theory were employed to extract the comprehensive optimal solution. The simulation results on a power system with large scale wind farms demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method, and the impacts of wind power to power systems optimal dispatch were analyzed from the points of energy saving and emission reduction. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Dicriminative Feature Weighted Hausdorff Distance for Face
   Recognition (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Hausdorff distance; face recognition; LDA; weighting function
AB The different face regions have different degrees of importance for face recognition. In previous weighted Hausdorff distance (HD) measures for face recognition, the weighting function are proposed to try to describe the discriminative properties of face images effectively. Motivated by the basic idea of weighting function for HD, a new weighting function based on Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA), due to its efficient discriminative ability, is proposed to weight different face edge points. The new weighted HD, termed Edge LDA Weighted HD (ELWHD), is applied to face recognition. Experiments comparing with pervious HD measures on ORL face database show the new method achieves higher recognition rate. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Low Multilinear Rank Tensor Completion with Missing Data
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE tensor completion; matrix completion; missing data; low rank; image
   inpainting
AB We present a novel method for tensor completion with missing data. The problem of missing data comes up in many areas of science and engineering including data mining, machine learning, biomedical signal, and computer vision. These data are always very large and have multi-modes. Therefore, we need a well method to find the missing data of multi-way arrays (i.e., tensors). In this paper we propose an algorithm to solve the problem by tensor multilinear rank minimization. The contribution of our paper is that we convert tensor rank minimization to minimize the mode-n rank of a tensor along each mode and then formulate as low rank matrix completion for mode-n matricization of a tensor. The resulting nuclear norm related minimization problem can be efficiently solved by many recent developed methods. Our numerical results on randomly generated data demonstrate that our algorithm is quick and provides much better recoverability than a few state-of-art tensor completion algorithms. Numerical experiments on image inpainting problems demonstrate the effectiveness of our method in real world. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Tan, Huachun; Feng, Jianshuai] Beijing Inst Technol, Dept Transportat Engn, Beijing 100081, Peoples R China.
RP Tan, HC (reprint author), Beijing Inst Technol, Dept Transportat Engn, Beijing 100081, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: "An Algorithm of Mining Spatial Topology Association Rules
   Based on Complement Set" (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE spatial data mining; topology association rules; multilayer transverse
   association; double search; complement set
AB According to these shortcomings when Apriori is used to mining spatial topology association rules. This paper proposes an algorithm of mining spatial topology association rules based on complement set, which is used to mining spatial multilayer transverse association rules from spatial database. This algorithm generate candidate frequent topological itemsets not only by up search strategy as Apriori, but also by computing complement set of candidate from up search strategy, which is suitable for mining any spatial topological frequent itemsets. This algorithm compresses a kind of spatial topological relation to form an integer. By the way, firstly, the algorithm may efficiently reduce some storage space when creating mining database. Secondly, the algorithm is fast to obtain topological relation between two spatial objects, namely, it may easily compute support of candidate frequent itemsets. Finally, the algorithm may fast generate candidate via double search strategy, i.e. one is that it connects ( k+1)-candidate frequent itemsets of k-frequent itemsets as up search strategy, the other is that it computes complement set of (k+1)-candidate frequent itemsets. The result of experiment indicates that the algorithm is able to extract spatial multilayer transverse association rules from spatial database via efficient data store, and it is very efficient to extract any frequent topology association rules. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Kinetics of Phosphorus Removal and Recovery as Struvite from
   Wastewaters with Medium-low Phosphorous Concentration (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE phosphorus removal and recovery; low phosphorous contained wastewater;
   crystallization kinetics
ID CRYSTALLIZATION; PRECIPITATION
AB Batch experiments with simulated low-phosphorous-containing wastewater were carried out to observe the effects of environmental conditions on MAP nucleation and crystallization kinetics. Results showed that higher pH and lower temperature enhanced the process of the MAP crystallization. The kinetics of phosphorus removal as struvite (magnesium ammonium phosphate, MAP) in its crystallization under various conditions, including pH, initial phosphorus concentration, molar ratio of Mg/N and N/P, were investigated. The nucleation of MAP followed a first-order reaction in wastewaters with the initial phosphate<80mg.L-1, compared with those followed second-order reactions in wastewater with initial phosphate >100mg.L-1. The crystallization rate of MAP increased with the improving of ammonium and magnesium dosage. The ammonium amendment has a more significant effect on MAP crystallization kinetics than that of magnesium. When the initial phosphate concentrations of the wastewater were low, the factor of supersaturation level has an effect of exponential order on the induction times for MAP nucleation. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A New Numerical Method for Heat Conduction Equations
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication

TI RETRACTED: Study on Nitrogen Removal in A(2)O reactor with fluidized
   carriers (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE A(2)O process; fluidized carrier; nitrogen removal; municipal wastewater
AB A(2)O process with fluidized carriers was used to treat municipal wastewater. Put fluidized carriers sharing 40% volume into aerobic zone to enhance nitrifying capacity of the system. The average of NH4+-N removel rate was about 83.7%, and the tiptop could reach 95.16%. The average of TN removal rate was 60.3%, and the tiptop could reach 73.7%. The TN removal was beyond the bacteria assimilation. TN removal rate could be as high as 16.3% of the whole reactor. The system showed a significant phenomenon of simultaneous nitrification and denitrification. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Measurement and transmission of steering wheel angle based on
   FlexRay (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE FlexRay; steer-by-wire; photoelectric encoder; phase discriminator;
   steering angle
AB FlexRay is one of the next communication standard of automobile network system. Compare with traditional CAN bus, it has many advantages like dererministic communication and support fault-tolerance. This paper chooses steer-by-wire (SBW) system as application object of FlexRay bus, show that FlexRay is better than CAN in safety-critical system. First, analyze the characteristics of FlexRay and desigan a simplified SBW system. Then, Measure the steering wheel angle and design FlexRay communication network, include the configuration of key parameters and distribution of tasks for two nodes of SBW system. Finally, the experiment of simplified SBW was performed. The experiment result shows that the characteristics of FlexRay are more suitable than CAN in safety-critical system. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

DE Lanthanum oxide; Load; Characterizing
AB This paper studies the preparation method of Lanthanum-loaded bentonite sorbent. By XRD and TEM, the paper explored the structure of bentonite and its modification mechanism and the adsorptive property of Phosphate of modified bentonite was studied as well. The result suggests that the unmodified bentonite has little adsorptivity of Phosphate, but the modified Bentonite by lanthanum oxide can adsorb phosphorus well, and it may be made into a potential dephosphorization absorbent. TI RETRACTED: Marginal Analysis Model of Economic Growth and Environmental
   Pollution (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES

CL Singapore, SINGAPORE

DE Marginal Analysis Model; Economic Growth; Environmental Pollution
AB The development of industry economy cans not get away from nature environment to prop up. It is big, researching on economic growth and environment pollution. Economic growth action has been object for many countries. The traditional mode of economic growth led to serious environmental pollution. Facing three major scientific issues that called economic growth, resources and environment, we will strengthen marginal analysis of economic growth on theory. According to traditional marginal analysis model, we propose a model of marginal analysis model of economic growth and environmental pollution. Analysis by adding environmental pollution, this paper, we propose a cost of economy growth, and gives control of economic growth for the cost of environment pollution. TI RETRACTED: Supervised Discriminant Projection for Feature Extraction
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE unsupervised discriminant projection (UDP); supervised discriminant
   projection (SDP); feature extraction; face recognition
ID RECOGNITION; FACE
AB Unsupervised discriminant projection (UDP) finds an embedding subspace that preserves local structure information, and uncovers and separates embedding corresponding to different manifolds. Though UDP has been applied in many fields, it has limits to solve the classification tasks, such as the ignorance of the class information. Thus, a novel subspace method, called supervised discriminant projection (SDP), is proposed for face recognition in this paper. In our method, the class information was utilized in the procedure of feature extraction. In SDP, the local structure of the original data is constructed according to a certain kind of similarity between data points, which takes special consideration of both the local information and class information. Experiments conducted on two popular face image databases (Yale and AR) demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Wang, Jianguo; Zhou, Changying] Tangshan Coll, Dept Comp Sci & Technol, Tangshan 063000, Peoples R China.
RP Wang, JG (reprint author), Tangshan Coll, Dept Comp Sci & Technol, Tangshan 063000, Peoples R China.
EM wjgfwjg@163.com

   Yang J, 2007, IEEE T PATTERN ANAL, V29, P650, DOI 10.1109/TPAMI.2007.1008
   Zhu M., 2006, RROC INT C COMP VIS, V1, P132

TI RETRACTED: Fuzzy 2D Maximum Scatter Discriminant Analysis For Feature
   Extraction (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE feature extraction; face recognition; 2DMSD; fuzzy 2DMSD; fuzzy
   k-nearest neighbor (FKNN)
ID HIGH-DIMENSIONAL DATA; SAMPLE-SIZE PROBLEM; FACE RECOGNITION; LDA;
   ALGORITHM; PCA
AB A novel method of face image feature extraction, called the fuzzy 2DMSD (F2DMSD) based on the 2D maximum scatter discriminant analysis and fuzzy set theory, is proposed. In the proposed one, the membership degree matrix is calculated by FKNN, then the membership degree is incorporated into the definition of the between-class scatter matrix and the within-class scatter matrix. Then the fuzzy between-class scatter matrix and the fuzzy within-class scatter matrix are obtained. Experiments conducted on the FERET face databases and the Yale face database demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Wang, Jianguo; Zhou, Changying; Yao, Hongbo] Tangshan Coll, Dept Comp Sci & Technol, Tangshan 063000, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Modeling, Simulating and Experiment of an Autonomous Surface
   Vehicle (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Nonlinear Modeling; Autonomous Surface Vehicle; Simulating; Experiment
AB This paper presents a nonlinear model of a catamaran-style Autonomous Surface Vehicle (ASV) thrust with twin fixed propellers, which are driven by DC electric motors. A total model including resistance of boat body, propulsion force and driving characteristics of motor is established. Response for a full range of the ASV motion is simulated according to the model, based on which the performance of the ASV is discussed. Experiment results from sea test are in accord with the ones from simulating, which validate the nonlinear model. Compared with the classical linearized models, the advantage of the nonlinear model lies in convenience for dealing with system response for the full range of ASV motion. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Morphological filter based correlation matching tracking
   algorithm (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Image Segmentation; BMCD; Correlation Tracking; Morpholog
AB This paper focuses on the template matching problem which is a classic arithmetic in the field of TV tracking. In the proposed scheme, we first make use of the average grey method to do image segmentation, and get the birnarized image. Then, filter the image with some math morphology. At last, a newly designed correlation matching arithmetic based on BMCD is used to do TV tracking. Experimental results show that our method has strong anti-interference capability, so it can be used for target tracking under complex backgrounds, and our method fits for real-time image processing. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Optimization of Process Plan by Genetic Algorithms (GAs)
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE computer-aided process planning(CAPP); process plan; genetic algorithm;
   optimization
AB Optimization of process plan is very complex and difficult in CAPP. Based on the analysis of part features and process constraints among the features, a GA is applied to optimization of process plan. Process plan is optimized using the reasonable coding strategy, objective function, operators of selection, crossover and mutation. An application sample is developed to illuminate the process of optimization of process plan by the GA. The results show that the algorithm can obtain optimal or near-optimal process plan which meets specific production requirements. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Development and Validation of a Numerical Model of Subsurface
   Flow Constructed Wetlands (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE numerical model; constructed wetland; TP; removal
ID MULTICOMPONENT REACTIVE TRANSPORT; PERFORMANCE
AB In this paper a three dimensional numerical model was developed for modeling solute removal in subsurface flow constructed wetlands. The numerical model was applied to modeling TP removal in the horizontal subsurface constructed wetland (HSSF) and the wavy subsurface constructed wetland (WSSF). The simulated values of TP at the outlet had a good agreement with the experimental results in both HSSF and WSSF. The numerical model could be used as a practical tool for design and operation optimization. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Energy Evaluation of Multi Split Air Conditioners with Indoor
   Compressors (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Air conditioner; heat exchanger; compressor; energy conservation
AB An air-conditioning system is developed to solve the problems occurring in the conventional split or multi-split air conditioners. The compressors of the system are installed indoors. In each air-conditioned room, the compressor was controlled independently. The cycle performance is evaluated based on the thermodynamic mathematical model. Results indicated that, at the part load, cooling capacity that the system produces increases, and higher COP obtains. Obviously, energy conservation for the proposed system is better than that for the conventional split or multi-split air conditioner. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Analysis of Energy Conservation in a Hybrid Groundwater
   Source Heat Pump (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Heat pump; energy conservation; coefficient of performance (COP);
   groundwater; fresh air load
ID SYSTEMS
AB The hybrid GWSHP air conditioning system uses low grade geothermal energy stored in groundwater to handle outdoor air directly. It is the GWSHP air conditioning coupled with the groundwater pretreatment fresh air system. Based on the thermodynamic mathematical model, cycle performance and energy consumption of the proposed system are evaluated. The results indicate that outdoor air fraction (OAF) has an obvious influence on the effect of energy saving in the hybrid GWSHP air conditioning system. The hybrid GWSHP is especially suitable for the building with large spaces or with the large fresh air fraction. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Design of a Simple 3-Lead ECG Acquisition System Based on
   MSP430F149 (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE ECG; Data Acquisition; Bluetooth; MSP430F149
AB Cardiovascular disease is one of the major diseases which threat human health, and ECG is the primary means of diagnosis of cardiovascular disease. This paper mainly introduces the design procedure of a simple 3-lead ECG acquisition system based on MSP430F149, introduces the structure and function of the device, finally introduces the function of each module, circuit design and the program design. The device completes the process of data acquisition using the ultra-low power microcontroller MSP430F149, and collects ECG signal to A/D sampling and conversion. It sends the ECG information to the patient phone by the Bluetooth module. This paper explains the software design process in detail, and the realization of a hardware design and optimization. The main content of software design is the data collection and the serial communication module. The software design includes the main program, timer-A interrupt, button interrupted, A/D converter, and serial communication program. This design can create a new device of 3-Lead ECG. system. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: METRASYS-Sustainable Traffic Management in Mega Cities
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Environment; Transport; Evaluation; REGOZON
AB Environmental impact evaluation is an essential component in environmental impact assessment study for any developmental project. In China, the rapid development of local and regional transportation systems has been accompanied by environmental problems, which prove to be detrimental for the economic development, social stability and public health. The project METRASYS provide a prototype for an integrated environmental monitoring and simulation system. This project deals with one of the most exigent problems of current and future mega cities and metropolitan regions. Under a scenario, various case studies of environmental impacts caused by transport in urban areas have been studied using the REGOZON model. This model includes a built-in mesoscale meteorological model that computes the local meteorological fields from synoptic fields. Since the emission model strongly depends on the other submodels, the whole system architecture for traffic flow, traffic emissions and air pollution dispersion will also be introduced. This paper describes the methodology used to evaluate these impacts. Data bases for model input and simulation results, as well as a graphic user interface for spatial data visualization. Some of the results are presented here in this paper, in particular a scenario analysis for the region Hefei. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Urban Transport System Evaluation Using FCD (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Floating Car Data; GPS; Traffic analysis
AB The use of FCD provides an efficient way to estimate speeds and traffic state. In Hefei this technology has been developed that provides real-time traffic information within Hefei's two ring road. It is based on the collection of localisation data, speed, direction of travel and time information from GPS in vehicles that are being driven. The scope of the project is to development and creation of a Web based data mart for the collection of FCD. The aim of this traffic management is to improve traffic flows by promoting more efficient use of the capacity of existing road infrastructure and transportation networks. For high quality traffic and safety information services, floating car data are essential to generate content. This system coverage is up to 80% and the accuracy of the information can reach more than 85%. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Remote sensing image denoising based on watershed and
   Bayesian estimation threshold wavelet algorithm (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Image denoising; Bayesian estimation threshold; wavelet; watershed;
   remote sesnsing
AB Remote sensing system has been drawn extensive attentions for environment monitoring, while the quality of the remote sensed image play essential role during information interpretation. In order to enhance and improve the noised image, a combined algorithm has been established for one 256 x 256 AVIRIS detected image. The watershed filter as well as the histogram adjustment is proposed for recovering image contrast from the blurring background, while the Bayesian estimated threshold wavelet method is put forward to attenuate the Gauss noise. Simulation indicates that the combined algorithm can more effectively recover the edge of the blurred image, and the Bayesian estimation threshold is more effective than the hard or soft threshold during wavelet decompressing. The combined algorithm proposed in this article can be directly integrated in remote sensing image analyzing software to obtain higher accuracy for environmental interpretation and pattern recognition. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Generation simulating of center dot OH (A(2)Sigma(+))
   radicals in pulse streamer discharged poison gas removal system
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE center dot OH(A(2)Sigma(+)) radical; pulsed stream discharge; numerical
   stimulation; poison gas removal
ID DIELECTRIC BARRIER DISCHARGE; CORONA DISCHARGE; KINETICS; PLASMAS
AB Pulsed discharge system has been drawn extensive attentions for harmful gas removal, while the center dot OH radicals play essential role during the removal reactions. In order to clarify the center dot OH radical generation process, a zero dimensional numerical model has been established for the N-2/H2O System in negative pulsed streamer discharge instrument. The model is verified based on comparison between the simulated and the experimentally detected time-resolved fluorescence of center dot OH(A(2)Sigma(+)) radicals. The concentration variance of H2O and N-2 versus time implies that the N-2 molecules exhaust major part of the injecting energy during discharge, and the main path to produce center dot OH radicals include the excited center dot OH(A(2)Sigma(+)) formation in pulse discharge and the center dot OH((XII)-I-2) formation by energy transfer from excited N-2 to the H2O molecules after pulse discharge. The concentration of N-2 is the critical factor to manipulate the center dot OH(A(2)Sigma(+)) production dynamic, presented as the decrease of N-2 initial proportion heightening the production concentration of center dot OH(A(2)Sigma(+)), while the generation dynamic more delayed. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: The impact of free-air CO2 enrichment (FACE) on microelements
   concentration in soil solution in the rice season (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Elevated CO2; microelements; soil solution; rice season
AB China FACE (Free-air Carbon Dioxide Enrichment) system was used to study the effects of elevated CO2 on microelements concentration in soil solution at different depths in the rice season. The results showed that elevated atmospheric CO2 had different effects on Fe, Mn, Cu and Zn concentration in soil solution at different stages. Elevated CO2 had a trend of increasing the concentration of Fe, Mn, Cu and Zn in soil solution at different depths, although mostly had no significant difference. Elevated CO2 had the trend of increasing the average Fe concentration at all soil layers, although the effects of elevated [CO2] were not significant. Elevated CO2 significantly increased Mn concentration in soil solution at 30cm layer (P=0.020). The results indicated that the geochemistry cycle of the microelements of soils in the agricultural ecosystem could be influenced by elevated CO2 in the atmosphere. The response of microelements in soil solution in rice season to elevated atmospheric CO2 needs further study. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Study on the Adsorption Performance of Furfural Residue for
   Methyl Violet (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Furfural residue; Adsorption; Methyl violet; Adsorption isotherm
ID AQUEOUS-SOLUTIONS; ACID DYE; EFFLUENT; REMOVAL; ADSORBENT
AB The adsorption performance of methyl violet from aqueous solution by furfural residue was studied. The results show that the adsorption of methyl violet on furfural residue reached equilibration by 60 minutes. The removal efficiency of methyl violet in aqueous solution on furfural residue of methyl violet achieved the 94.96% in 50mL 200mg. L-1 methyl violet aqueous solution with adding 4g/L furfural residue. The temperature had an effect on the removing of the methyl violet on furfural residue, and the adsorption of furfural residue to menthylene blue was decalescence reaction. The relationship between adsorbing capacity (qe) and equilibrium mass concentration (rho e) is in accordance with the isothermal adsorption equations of Freundlich and Langmuir. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Analytic Criterion And Algorithm For The Lowest Common
   Ancestor Of Two Neighboring Nodes In A Complete Binary Tree (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Binary tree; lowest common ancestor; Criterion
AB Finding the lowest common ancestor (LCA) of two nodes in a binary tree has been focused both in graph theory and computer science. The paper puts forward and proves an analytic criterion for the LCA of two neighboring nodes in a complete binary tree. The criterion mainly concerns addition, subtraction and bitwise operations, needs no searching procedures and thus is easy to implement in software programming as well as hardware programming. An algorithm that has logarithmic time complexity is also presented with C-language implementation in the paper. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Exceptional Families and Nonlinear Complementarity Problems
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE complementarity problem; quasi-P-*-mapping; P(tau, alpha, beta)
   -mapping; alternative theorem
ID PATH
AB In this paper, we study the following Linear Complementarity problem: f : R-n -> R-n, find x >= 0, such that f(x) >= 0, x(T) f(x) = 0. We use Poineare-Bohn's homotopy invariance theorem of degree to derive an alternative theorem, and give a new exceptional families. Based on this result, for the nonlinear complementarity problems with a quasi-P-*-mapping or a P(tau, alpha, beta) -mapping or a semi-monotone mapping, a sufficiently condition is established to assure the existence and boundedness of solution curve (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd.
