TI RETRACTED: Exploit on Information Retrieval based on Semantic Web
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Semantic web; Information Retriveal
AB Over the past few years, the volume of information available through the World Wide Web has been expanding exponentially. The Web has given us access to millions of resources, irrespective of their physical location and language. However, since current Web design targets human consumption, relied on textual keywords to index and retrieve documents, which may return inaccurate and incomplete results. To address this issue, in 2001, Berners-Lee proposed semantic web with the idea of adding facilities for machine-understood descriptions of metadata to current web. Semantic-based Information Retrieval (IR) represents both document and queries using semantic concepts, instead of keywords, and performs retrieval in that concept space. Its purpose is to design to improve traditional web searching and it is based on an explicit representation of semantics about web resources and real world object and aims to improve both the proportion of relevant material and the proportion of precision results. In this paper, we propose architecture of information retrieval based on semantic web. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 YanShan Univ, Sch Econ & Management, Qinhuangdao 066004, Peoples R China.
RP Wang, YL (reprint author), YanShan Univ, Sch Econ & Management, Qinhuangdao 066004, Peoples R China.

ID PROPAGATION

TI RETRACTED: Removal of Sulfide Ion from Oil Wastewater Using an
   Electrochemical Method (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE electrochemical oxidation; sulfide; oil wastewater; Ti/IrO2 anode
ID HYDROGEN-SULFIDE; OXIDATION; CHEMICALS; ANODE
AB The removal of sulfide from oil wastewater containing a great number of chloride ions was studied with electrochemical oxidation technique using Ti/IrO2 anode. Electrochemical method was effective for the removal of sulfide from aquatic environment. It was found that current density can enhance the removal of sulfide. When the current density is 25 mA/cm(2), nearly 90.5% sulfide was oxidized at 10 min. To be completely oxidized, high initial concentration of sulfide required larger current density or more electrolytic time. It is generally realized that sulfide can be successfully cleaned by the electrochemical oxidation at Ti/IrO2 anode. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Wang, Yuting; Feng, Chuanping] China Univ Geosci, Sch Water Resources & Environm, Beijing, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Traversal Grey Model for Water Consumption Prediction
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Grey model; Water consumption prediction; Traversal grey model; Point
   based grey model
AB Grey model (GM) method is widely used to forecast water consumption due to its strengths of little original data needed. To increase the precision of GM(1,1) and forecast urban water consumption accurately, we construct Traversal Grey Model (T-GM(1,1)) by minimum total residual sum of square. When we used the T-GM(1,1) to predict water requirement in some city, it showed that the mean absolute error, mean absolute percentage error and the maximum absolute percentage error are 0.77x10(6)m(3)/a, 3.56% and 12.58% respectively. Thus, the simulative precision of T-GM(1,1) is much better than that of GM(1,1). In conclusion, the T-GM(1,1) can predict the water consumption in the city and reduce the unstable factors that influence the forecast. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Wei Bigui; Zhang Guozhen; Awu Fuping; Liu Jianlin] Lanzhou Jiaotong Univ, Engn Res Ctr Cold & Arid Reg Water Resource Compr, Minist Educ, Sch Environm & Municipal Engn, Lanzhou 730070, Gansu, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Land Cover Classification and Information Extraction of
   Multi-temporal High Resolution Images (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Remote sensing; object-oriented; edge effect; segmentation;
   multi-temporal data classification; Kunming Dianchi Lake Introduction
ID METROPOLITAN-AREA
AB This paper presents a technique of land cover classification of high-spatial resolution image which consists of two Quick Bird data with obvious differences to implement classification and improve classification accuracy, one of the data is covered by snow. The study area locates at the sub-watershed of Kunming Dianchi Lake watershed. There is an obvious border between two images after data fusion, which cannot be cancelled by data processing. Hence, the classification of land cover by use of a same process set in Definiens developer 7.0 becomes difficult or causes errors, that is so called edge effect. Our research develops a practical process to extract the classification information from these special regions to form thematic map for environmental and socioeconomic applications. Six classes, including forest, cultivated land, architecture, water, bare soil and shadow are classified successfully. In the class thematic map, the border effect was cancelled completely. The methodology was developed in an experimental way by suitable selection of processes, parameters and methods. Overall accuracy of classification reaches 92.32%, with Kappa statistics 0.8914. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: The Aeronautics Face-gear NC Hobbing Machining Technology
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE face-gear; hob; equation of tooth surface; simulation; hobbing machining
AB Face-gear drives become the main direction of research for aeronautical drives because of their special advantages. Face-gear machining problems have became to baffle the embedded research for face-gear. The basal coordinate systems of face-gear hobbing were setted up according to the face-gear hobbing theory. The hobbing surface equation of face-gear was established by using the equation of pinion tooth surface and matrix for coordinate transform based on the gear geometry and applied theory, then the hobbing tooth surface constrain conditions for dedendum undercutting were analyzed, at the same time, the hobbing nodal points were used to construct the three-dimensional basal worm model of face-gear hob by recurring to the three-dimensional software. Furthermore, the special hob for face-gear machining was designed and manufactured. The exact assembly and machining simulation were finished by using the program development software VC++6.0 and the UG customization function in the light of the face-gear hobbing theory. It validates the hob correctness and gets the gear hobbing program. According to the result of machining simulation, face-gear numerical control(NC) hob machining was realized in the four-axis NC machine tool. It improves the cutting efficiency and establishs the base for face-gear grinding. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Performance of Nitrogen and Phosphorus Removal of Municipal
   Wastewater in Sequencing Batch Biofilm Reactor (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE SBBR; Nitrogen; Phosphorus; Municipal Wastewater
ID NITRIFICATION
AB A lab-scale innovative sequencing batch biofilm reactor (SBBR) was developed to treat municipal wastewater. At normal temperature, the operation conditions of the SBBR were 2 min inflow -> 180 min non aeration -> 300 min aeration -> 30 min sedimentation -> 10 min outflow. The SBBR system developed in this study was a high efficiency and saving energy of wastewater treatment technology. The average removal efficiencies of NH4+-N, TN, TP and COD reached 95.8%, 72.8%, 97.5%, 92.5%, respectively. The effluent concentration of NH4+-N, TN, TP and COD satisfied with the first level A criteria specified in Discharge Standard of Pollutants for Municipal Wastewater Treatment Plant (GB 18919-2002). Moreover simultaneous nitrification and denitrification(SND) was preceeded in the system. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Preparation and Characterization of Magnetic Fe3O4
   Nanoparticles Coated by Oleic Acid (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Magnetic nanoparticles; co-precipitation; oleic acid; Spectrophotometric
   analysis
ID IRON-OXIDE NANOPARTICLES
AB Magnetic Fe3O4 nanoparticles were prepared by co-precipitation of catalytically oxidized liquids added with ferric and NH3 center dot H2O, and then oleic acid (OA) was coated onto the surface of it. After that, the remaining of OA in the reaction mixture was detected with the UV-visible spectrophotometer, and then calculate the coating rate of OA by subtraction. It's concluded that when the mass ratio of OA and magnetic particles is approximate to 2.69, mixing for 45minutes under temperature of 70 degrees C, pH of 7.9, the optimal coating rate added up to 75.3% through TG curve analysis. X-ray diffraction measurements showed the spinel structure for the Fe3O4 nanoparticles. Transmission electron microscopy revealed the magnetic particle size of about 25nm, and agglomerate seriously, but particles coated by OA dispersed well in the solution with an increasing size. Meanwhile, the saturation magnetization of particles decreased from 58.72emu/g to 1.42emu/g after modifying. FTIR spectra indicate that oleic acid molecules have been bound onto the surface of the magnetic nanoparticles by Fe-COOR chemical bonds. Furthermore, TG studies showed the adsorption of OA molecules on the particles by chemisorption, further verified that it's practical to calculate the coating rate of oleic acid by spectrophotometric detection method. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Wu Jingjing; Li Dengxin] Donghus Univ, Sch Environm Sci & Engn, Shanghai 2016200, Peoples R China.
RP Wu, JJ (reprint author), Donghus Univ, Sch Environm Sci & Engn, Shanghai 2016200, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Digital Image based Fractal Dimension Analysis of Activated
   Sludge Floc from Biological Wastewater Treatment Process (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Faractal dimension; Image analysis; Biological wastewater treatment;
   Activated sludge
AB The image analysis has been used in this study to calculate the fractal dimension for activated sludge floc collected from biological wastewater treatment plant. The fractal dimension value calculated was in the range of 1.71-1.79 and was found to be inversely correlated to the activated sludge SVI value. This suggested that the fractal dimension index can be used for early warning of activated sludge settling problem during biological wastewater treatment process. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. DE semantic web; information; retrieval
AB The World Wide Web plays a very important role in an integral part of most societies today. Without any doubt, the WWW has been one of the fastest growing and most pervasive phenomenons in history. Hence, it is natural to retrieve information from it and web search engines have become one of most used application in Internet. Unfortunately, the unstructured nature and huge volume of information accessible over networks have made it hard for users to sift through and find relevant in formation. In order to address this issue, the web semantic has been proposed. Research show that the semantic web will be the next generation web and the information retrieval towards at semantic web will play an important role in out's dairy life. In this paper we explore information retrieval (IR) towards the semantic web and propose a conceptual architecture for semantic web information retrieval systems. TI RETRACTED: Reduction of Power Consumption in Wireless Sensor Networks
   for Railway Disaster Prevention and Safety Monitoring System (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Wireless Sensor Network; sensor node; energy consumption; high-speed
   railway
AB Wireless sensor network has many advantages. One of the primary benefits is their independence from the wiring costs and constraints, which makes it is suitable for monitoring the environmental conditions around the high-speed railway. However, the energy of the sensor node is limited and railways are often located in remote area. If batteries have to be replaced frequently, the initial cost savings will be lost. Therefore, power efficiency is a critical requirement for wireless sensor networks. In this paper, two algorithms have been investigated for application of wireless sensor network in Railway Disaster Prevention and Safety Monitoring System, which are Advanced Direction-aware Algorithm and Cluster Head Selection Algorithm based on the Dynamic Energy Threshold respectively. Theoretically, both algorithms can effectively extend the lifetime of the wireless sensor network. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Fuzzy Analysis of Impact Factors on Shoal Wetland Pricing in
   Xiamen (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Resource pricing; CVM; Subordinate Function; Comprehensive Evaluation
   Matrix; Xiamen City
AB This paper focus on pricing methodology research about resources contain of non-use value. Reasonable and accurate assessment of resources plays an important role in the management of coastal zone. But valuation of resources that contain of non-use value is still unsatisfactory on its validity and reliability. This paper extends the study of pricing model, which based on Subordinate Function of resource price, to a forward step research to analyze of how the resources are priced by respondents. And there are three steps to reach this aim. A survey about shoal wetland price per year is conducted to citizens of Xiamen firstly, then the pricing results of respondent are disassembled to a series weights of factors through the resolution of fuzzy relationship equations. Finally, causality between characters of respondent and weights of factor are analyzed by means of multivariate correlation analysis. The study indicates that the "Knowledge about the resource" is the most influential character of respondent that impact on a resource pricing, while "Income" is the second of influential. And "Distance from the location of resource" has the least impact on the pricing. However, another finding is that none of the 5 characters are critical to a resource pricing. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

DE SOA (Service oriented architecture); Web Services; equipment
   acquisition; information system
AB During the process of equipment acquisition information, some relevant information systems are developed, but these systems are isolated each other, with short interoperability. Therefore, it is time to find a method to systemize the different subsystems and to achieve the interconnection, intercommunication and interoperability of heterogeneous information systems. This paper first analyzes the actualities of the equipment acquisition information management, and then puts forward an idea of the equipment acquisition information system based on service oriented architecture (SOA). After that, the conception and architecture of SOA is introduced. Based on SOA, the framework of equipment acquisition information system is proposed, and expatiates on the advantages of equipment acquisition information system based on SOA. TI RETRACTED: Pretreatment of Concentrated and Saliferous Wastewater From
   Dye Manufacturing by Electrochemical Oxidation (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE dye wastewater; internal microelectrolysis; elcteolysis; COD removal;
   electrochemical oxidation
ID ACTIVATED CARBON-FIBER; REACTIVE DYES; ANODE; ELECTROLYSIS; DEGRADATION
AB This paper has investigated the effect of the combination of the internal microelectrolysis and the electrolysis over activated carbon cloth (ACC) electrodes on dye wastewater treatment and analyzed the efficiency of the chemical oxygen demand (COD) removal. The combined electrochemical oxidation is mainly influenced by iron chips/granular activated carbon (GAC)/wastewater volumetric ratio, current intensity, and electrode gap etc. It was found that up to 63 % COD could be removed under the conditions of iron/GAC/wastewater volumetric ratio of 30: 30: 1200, current intensity of 9.2 mA cm-2, electrode gap of 2 cm, and run time of 30 h. In addition, the current efficiency (CE) and energy consumption (EC) were also estimated under different current intensity and electrode gap. These results suggest the oxidation process is the promising, economical alternative for pretreating concentrated and saliferous wastewater from dye manufacturing. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Relief Wrapper based PLS for Gene Analysis (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Relief Wrapper; Partial Least Squares; Microarray analysis
ID PRINCIPAL COMPONENT ANALYSIS; EXPRESSION DATA; CLASSIFICATION; TUMOR
AB Partial Least Squares (PLS) is one of the widely used dimension reduction methods for analysis of gene expression microarray data, the size of the reduced space by PLS is critical to generalization performance of classifiers. Traditionally the top several components of PLS are selected for modeling according to the descending order of eigenvalues. In this paper, we prove that not all the top features are useful; features should be selected from all the components by feature selection methods. Here we demonstrate the effect of feature selection for PLS based dimension reduction. As a case study, PLS is combined with Relief Wrapper method to get more robust and efficient dimensional space, and then the constructed data from the selected components is used as input for classifiers. Experimental results on gene microarray data illustrate that not only the top features newly extracted by PLS are important; therefore, feature selection should be performed to select subsets from new features to improve generalization performance of classifiers. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Xia Jing] Chaohu Coll, Dept Math, Chaohu, Peoples R China.
RP Bu, HL (reprint author), Chaohu Coll, Dept Comp Sci, Chaohu, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: A Grid-based clustering Routing Protocol for Wireless Sensor
   Networks based on GROUP (Retracted Article)

   2011

SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Clustering; Grid-based; WSN; Routing protocol
AB This paper proposes a modification policy on GROUP (Grid-clustering Routing Protocol for Wireless Sensor Networks). This modification aims at getting a better performance, e. g., less average energy consumption of the whole network, less average end-to-end delay of data packet, than GROUP. We call the modified protocol GROUP-M. We simulated both GROUP-M and GROUP on ns2.34 platform, and made the comparison between them. The comparison results showed that our modification on GROUP is valid and effective. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Research on Statistical Process Control for Solvent Residual

DE Packaging Quality Management; SPC; (X)over-bar-R Control Chart;
   Packaging Materials
AB Statistical Process Control (SPC) and the basic tool of its controlling - control chart - are discussed in this paper based on the development of quality management, current situation of quality management of Chinese packaging enterprises, and the necessity of applying SPC. On this basis, (X) over bar -R control chart is used to analyze and control the solvent residual in the compound process. This work may allow field personnel to find the shortcomings in the quality control by noticing the corresponding of fluctuations and slow variations in the process in time. In addition, SPC also provides objective basis for the quality management personnel to assess semi-products or products quality. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. DE E-marketing conditions; enterprise; genetic support vector regression;
   prediction method
ID E-COMMERCE; SYSTEM
AB E-marketing quantity prediction of enterprise has a great impotance for enterprise to make up marketing strategy and carry out E-marketing activity. Genetic support vector regression is present to E-marketing quantity prediction of enterprise in the paper. Genetic algorithm can gain the suitable parameters for the support vector regression model. TI RETRACTED: Diagnosis of chatter type based on neural network (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Chatter; diagnosis; Type; BP neural network
AB By analyzing chatter dynamic model, the article studies chatter phenomenon between metal cutting tool and workpiece during the cutting. From the perspective of energy, phase position difference of chatter mark, phase position difference of vibration mode, lagging phase position angle and change rate about cutting force relative to the cutting speed are respectively determined as characteristic parameter of regenerative, coupling vibration, lagging and fricative mode of chatter. With the four input parameters, multilayer feed forward neural network learning algorithm is used to diagnose the type of cutting chatter, and experiments show that this method is effective. It is essential to take appropriate measures on vibration suppression. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Study on Vacuum membrane distillation process for RO drained
   wastewater from iron and steel industry (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE VMD; AVMD; RO drained wastewater; Hydrophobic hollow fiber; Chemical
   hardness removal
AB Novel hydrophobic polyvinylidene fluoride (PVDF) hollow fiber membrane was used in the treatment of a reverse osmosis (RO) concentrated water from iron and steel industry via vacuum membrane distillation (VMD) method and air-blowing vacuum membrane distillation (AVMD) method. Based on the characteristic of the industrial wastewater, the hardness removal method and proportion of the hardness removal agents were studied. Waste water with hardness removal was applied in both VMD and AVMD as feed water. The results were compared with those of raw water without pretreatment. It was found that the hardness removal method of NaOH is better than that of Ca(OH)2Na2CO3 both in hardness removal rate and cost. When the RO drained wastewater was pretreated, the flux of VMD process reached nearly 18kg/(m2.h) before the water was concentrated up to 15 times, the flux of AVMD process reached nearly 20kg/(m2.h) before the water was concentrated up to 7 times. Thereafter, with the increase of the concentration fold, the flux decreased gradually. As the concentration fold arrived at 30, salt crystallization was observed. However, when the wastewater without pretreatment was taken as the feed, the flux of both VMD process and AVMD process declined drastically. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Xin Lu; Jia Yue; Wu Chunrui; Lu Xiaolong] Tianjin Polytech Univ, TJPU, State Key Lab Hollow Fiber Membrane Mat & Proc, Tianjin, Peoples R China.

DE Capillary gas chromatography(GC); Organophos-phorus pesticide; Residues;
   Tea
AB In this research, a determination of 6 organophosphorus pesticide residues in the tea has been established by capillary gas chromatography. After rotary steam and condensation, the sample is filtered through 0.2 mu m membrane and determined by gas chromatography FPD detector. The peak time of six pesticide ranges from 9.077min to 32.420min. The average recovery ranges between 90.5% and 110.6%, RSD, between 1.3% and 8.1%, detection limits, between 0.0066 mu g.kg-1 and 0.0085 mu g.kg-1, and the correlation coefficient of the standard curve, between 0.99848 and 0.99988 in the concentration range of 0.01-1.0mg.L-1 (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: The Research on Ion Exchange Resin of Cement Solidification
   Treatment (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Ion Exchange Resin; Cement Solidification; Anti-compressive Strength;
   Containing Rate
AB This paper based on the reference to domestic and foreign cement solidification formula, studys the method and principle of solidification treatment of waste resin cement blended with ultra-fine siliceous dust and zeolite, analyzes the factors of the compressive strength index affecting the solidified cement, leaching index and swelling and etc., and based on the previous studies, the optimum cement solidification formula is:
   1. Cement: resin (water content 51.7%): water: silica dust: zeolite powder: water reducing agent = 1000: 420: 395: 60: 60: 8 (sample T4)
   2. Cement: resin (water content 51.7%): water: silica dust: zeolite powder: water reducer = 1000: 416: 352: 120: 30: 8 (sample T6) (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Investigation on Biofilm Activity in Vermifilter with Filter
   Media of Different Diameter (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Vermifilter; Biofilm biomass; Biofilm activity; VSS/SS
ID SCALE; WATER
AB Biofilm plays a crucial role on the biodegradation of organic matters in filter systems. In this study, two vermifilters (VFs, VF 1# was packed with 10 similar to 13mm and 6 similar to 9mm graded ceramic pellets, while VF 2# was packed with 6 similar to 9mm ceramic pellets entirely) were operated in parallel. The variations of biofilm biomass and biofilm activity along the depth of the reactors were investigated. The results indicated that the biofilm biomass and the biofilm activity in both vermifilters decreased first and increased subsequently. The ratio of volatile suspended solids (VSS) to suspended solids (SS) were progressively declined from 0.60 to 0.53 in VF 1#, and from 0.57 to 0.44 in VF 2#. The sludge reduction of VF 2# was 40.4%, 6.2% higher than that of VF 1#. These findings indicated that the vermifilter filled with 6 similar to 9mm ceramic pellets performed a better processing properties than the one filled with 10 similar to 13mm and 6 similar to 9mm graded ceramic pellets. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A Virtual Grasp Method Based on Grasp-Behavior-Model
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE virtual grasp; behavior model; overall stereotype & local modification;
   ergonomics
ID OBJECTS
AB Virtual grasp of 3D objects provides an intuitive way to interact with virtual objects. However, in current virtual grasp methods, Virtual Hand Model (VHM) has not played a role as an interactive subject, resulting into unrealistic virtual grasp. To enhance virtual grasp, a method based on Grasp Behavior Model (GBM), taking advantage of the biological phenomenon that behavior is often stereotyped, was proposed. A GBM was a medium integrating intent of human and attributes of Object Model for Grasping (OMG), giving VHM some intelligence. Accordingly, a proposed computerized Feasible Grasping Pattern Space (FGPS) of a given OMG changed the natural grasping process model and reinforced the intelligence. To make virtual grasp more realistic, a strategy of Overall Stereotype & Local Modification (OSLM) was introduced. Finally, a detailed framework of virtual grasp based on GBM, FGPS and OSLM was illustrated, including related works such as constructing GBM, OMG and VHM, defining reference frames etc. This method can make VHM understand human's order better, and let more physical sensations be provided to human. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A Multi-objective Particle Swarm Optimization Based on Swarm
   Energy Conservation (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE multi-objective optimization; MOPSO; swarm energy conservation
ID EVOLUTIONARY ALGORITHMS
AB An improved algorithm-multi-objective particle swarm optimization based on swarm energy conservation (SEC-MOPSO) is proposed, which is aimed to solve the problem of convergence and distribution in multi-objective particle swarm optimization (MOPSO) algorithm. Swarm energy conservation mechanism is used to update the velocity and position of particles. Besides, non-dominated sorting method, adaptive grid mechanism and elitism mechanism are also incorporated into SEC-MOPSO algorithm to improve search capabilities and avoid falling into the second-best non-dominated front. The simulation results show that SEC-MOPSO has better performance than MOPSO in distribution and convergence. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Water-saving Effect of Superabsorbent Polymers on Ordos Sandy
   Soil (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Soil available water; Soil moisture; Soil water characteristic curve;
   Soil available water
AB Utilization of Superabsorbent Polymers in Water-saving Agriculture offers a new way to improve water resources use efficiency and sustainable development. In order to research the water-saving effect on sandy soil of Superabsorbent Polymers, four typical Superabsorbent Polymers were divided into two groups for studying. Analysis of variance, curve fitting methods was used to test and analyze the changes of soil moisture and soil available water, through which ascertained the suitable SAPs for Ordos sandy soil. Results show that :(1) Superabsorbent Polymers evidencely ameliorated soil water characteristics. Concentration of SAP from 0.5% to 1% had a typical significance to Ordos sandy soil.(2) Superabsorbent Polymers effectively improved the water holding capacity of soil, and the ameliorating effect in low Soil water suctions(<0.8MPa) obviously superior to the high Soil water suctions(>0.8MPa).(3) In terms of soil available water of Ordos sandy soil, Polymers of Polyacrylate were better performance than Polymers of polyacrylamide in lower SAP concentrations (<0.5%), while in the higher SAP concentrations (>0.5%) is the opposite.(4) The study showed that the content of available soil moisture decreased by 20%similar to 37% after stored in dry conditions for 5 years to AGROFORESTRY absorbent polymer. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Remove as (III) from Aqueous Solution by Powder Mg(OH)(2)
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Mg(OH)(2); As(III); Adsorption; Isotherm; Wastewater treatment
AB Power Mg(OH)(2) was used to remove As(III) from arsenic-bearing wastewater. Results showed that Mg(OH)(2) had strong adsorptive property on As(III) ions with its adsorption capacity of 4.04 mg/L; Mg(OH)(2) adsorption on As(III) fit well with Langmuir Isotherm equation; As(III) removal rate increased with vibration time and input quantity of adsorbents while decreased as pH increased and effects were obvious; temperature had little affection on arsenic adsorption; As(III) removal rate can exceeded 99% when reaching equilibrium under condition As(III) concentration of 20 mg/L, Mg(OH)(2) input quantity of 2 g/L and pH of 3; Mg(OH)(2) adsorption was fast and can reach equilibrium in 60 min. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Effects of Dam Decommissioning on Flood Inundation in an
   Urban Area (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE water resource management; dam removal; flood inundation modeling
ID RIVER; MODEL
AB Flood control is the key issue when making decisions for dam decommissioning in China, especially in urban areas. The Heiwa Dam is a small aging dam that does not serve its original purpose. The dam owner proposed to decommission it. However, the local water resource managers opposed to this proposal, because they concern the potential changes to flood regime in the city. In order to identify flood inundation changes due to the dam decommissioning, 2D MIKE21 HD with 10-m spatial resolution was used to model the flood inundation for the decommissioning scenario and existing condition. The model was calibrated using the roughness coefficient. Modeling results showed that decommissioning of the Heiwa dam would neither significantly increase flood inundation area nor water depth at 50-yr flood event. Compared with existing-condition, only 1% of the whole inundation area had significant increase in inundation depth with absolute increase from 0.15 to 0.35 m and percentage changes larger than 30%. Modeling results indicated flow constriction due to the limited conveyance capacity of sewer system in the city had greater impact on flooding and flood control than the Heiwa Dam itself. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Performance Analysis of Clipping Noise Guided and Complex
   Base-Band Active-Set methods Based on Tone Reservation for PAPR
   Reduction in OFDM Systems (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE PAPR; CCDF; tone reservation; adaptive scale; constant scale; active-set
ID POWER RATIO REDUCTION; PAR REDUCTION; PEAK
AB Orthogonal frequency division multiplexing (OFDM) suffers from a high peak-to-average power ratio (PAPR). Tone reservation is a popular PAPR reduction technique that uses a set of reserved tones to design a peak-canceling signal. In this paper, the performance and complexity of clipping noise guided, complex base-band active-set methods based on tone reservation for PAPR reduction are analyzed and simulated. The simulation results show that the two clipping noise guided methods, the adaptive scale method and constant scale method, have better performance than complex base-band active-set methods. Furthermore, the complexity of the constant scale algorithm is lower than the adaptive scale and the complex base-band active-set algorithm. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Catalytic Ozonation of Raw Water from Songhua River with Nano
   TiO2 Supported by Zeolite (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE ozone; catalyst; nano; TiO2; raw water
AB In the present paper, nanosized TiO2 supported by zeolite was used in the ozonation of Songhua River as catalyst. The catalytic activity of TiO2/Zeolite for ozonation was testified by nitrobenzene removal, which is one kind of representatively resistant organic contaminant. And the removal of some organic and inorganic compounds existing in the Songhua River by TiO2/Zeolite catalyzed ozonation was investigated. GC-MS analysis showed that the Songhua River was obviously polluted by organic contaminants. Catalytic ozonation can remove about 30 kinds of organic matters from water and reduce the total organic peak area of feed water by 62.5%. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A new 3D statistical method for mobile channel model
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE propagation simulation; path loss; COST-Walfisch-Ikegami model; wireless
   systems
ID PROPAGATION
AB 3-dimension statistical method is used to simulate the popular micro-cell propagation model: COST231-Walfish-Ikegami model[6][7]. The extended model allows for improved path loss estimation by consideration the character of the urban environment parameters are lognormal random variables rather than deterministic. The numerical calculation results and trial measurement data is presented. Based on the measurement and modelling results, we find that the 3D COST231-WI model fits very well with the measurement result in the metropolitan scenario. The conclusion is useful and helpful to network planning in the future. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Cloud Point Extraction and Determination of Trace 2,
   4-Dichlorophenol by High Performance Liquid Chromatography with
   Ultraviolet-Detection (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE cloud point extraction (CPE); 2,4-dichlorophenol(2,4-DCP);
   high-performance liquid chromatography(HPLC); Triton X-100;
   environmental water samples
ID SOLID-PHASE EXTRACTION; WATER SAMPLES; PRECONCENTRATION; POLLUTANTS
AB A method based on cloud point extraction(CPE) was developed for the determination of 2,4-dichlorophenol in environmental water samples using high-performance liquid chromatography separation and ultraviolet (HPLC-UV) detection. The non-ionic surfactant Triton X-100 was chosen as extraction solvent. The parameters and affecting factors of extraction efficiency, such as concentration of Triton X-100 and sodium chloride, acidity of solution, equilibrium temperature, equilibrium time and centrifugation time were evaluated and optimized. Under the optimum conditions: 0.9% (w/v) Triton X-100, 0.2 mol/L sodium chloride and 0.4% (v/v) hydrochloride, heat-assisted at 80 degrees C for 60 min, the extraction efficiencies was more than 95%. The results show that the linear dynamic ranges of detection is 0.005 similar to 0.5 mg/L for 2,4-dihlorophenol with the correlation coefficient of 0.9998, and the limit of detection is 2.0x10(-2) mu g/L (3 sigma) with relative standard deviation (RSD) of 3.51% (n = 9). The enhancement factor can achieve 33 for the determination of 2,4-dichlorophenol in environmental water samples. The recoveries range from 94.4% to 104.0% for three environmental water samples. The proposed method is simple, rapid, sensitive, accurate and friendly to environment. It is suitable to the determination of 2,4-dichlorophenol in environmental water samples. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Yang Yingchun; Yi Chongshu; Ye Zhixiang; Yu Jing; Fu Mei] Chengdu Univ Informat Technol, Dept Resources & Environm, 24,Block 1,Xuefu Rd, Chengdu 610225, Sichuan, Peoples R China.
RP Yang, YC (reprint author), Chengdu Univ Informat Technol, Dept Resources & Environm, 24,Block 1,Xuefu Rd, Chengdu 610225, Sichuan, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: A Hybrid Ordering Scheme for Efficient Sparse Cholesky
   Factorization (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Cholesky factorization; hybrid ordering; nested dissection;
   lexicographic ordering; symbolic factorization
ID NESTED DISSECTION
AB When applying Cholesky factorization method to solving sparse symmetric positive definite system Ax = b, two classes of ordering algorithms are widely used to reduce the amount of fill. In view of their respective advantages and disadvantages, a parallel hybrid ordering scheme is proposed, which is proved to be effective by both theoretical analysis and parallel implementation. It is noteworthy that the algorithm can not only find a good ordering efficiently, but also achieve the result of symbolic factorization simultaneously. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

DE Mechanical vapor compression(MVC); classification of wastewater;
   viscosity; scaling

TI RETRACTED: Video-based Detection Method of Illegal Parking Vehicles
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE intelligent transportation system; background subtraction; morphology
   processing; detection of illegal parking
ID ALGORITHM
AB Aimed at the shortcomings of the manual detection of illegal parking vehicles, a new detection method was proposed to detect the illegal parking vehicles from real-time monitoring video sequence, which saved human and material resources. In this method, firstly, background subtraction based on adaptive threshold and binarization were used to eliminate background interference after image graying; secondly, morphology processing operations including improved erosion operation and improved dilation operation were used to extract the objects; finally, illegal parting detection was used to draw the outer rectangular frame of illegal parting cars through illegal parking judgment conditions and the camera would be controlled to capture the vehicle image which could be used to recognize the vehicle license plate. Experimental results show that this method can detect the illegal vehicles successfully and has the identification that can distinguish vehicles from non-vehicles, illegal parking from passing vehicles, and can mark and count the illegal vehicles. This method can be used for illegal parking monitoring in residential car park area to effectively control the phenomenon of illegal parking in order to reduce the waste of human and material resources and remedy the transport environment. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Slope Stability Evaluation by Cellular Ant Algorithm
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011

LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Cellular Ant Algorithm; Slope; Stability
AB There are many factors involved in slope stability evaluation and the principle ones acts differently under different slope environmental conditions. So the evaluation of slope stability demands for consideration for all kinds of factors generally with clear understanding of primary and secondary factors. Based on the theory of ant algorithms and cellular automaton, this paper puts forward a cellular ant algorithm and mathematic description with MATLAB to optimize the accuracy of slope stability evaluation and verifies the applicability of the algorithm through real project and achieves good results. TI RETRACTED: Research on the Contribution-Ratio Predication Method Applied
   to the Predication and Warning of the Risk of Roadbed Geological Hazards
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Contribution-ratio predication method; Evaluation factors; Roadbed
   geological hazard body; Predictable evaluation of risks
AB The predictable evaluation of the risk of roadbed geological hazards depends largely on the reliability of the fundamental information and the rationality of the mathematical model. As all the factors of the geological environment at different regions are different in the quality, the same index is likely to attach to the different fatalness grade at the different regions. Therefore, the application of the classical mathematical model to dividing the uniform standards for measuring still belongs to one of the challenging frontiers in the current international earth science field. In this paper we attempt to establish the mathematical model of contribution-ratio predication method in the predictable evaluation of the risk of roadbed geological hazards to determine the critical rainfall in which geological hazards take place, hoping to provide the theory reference for the predication and warning problems of the risk of roadbed geological hazards. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Analytic Hierarchy Process Model Evaluation on Surrounding
   Rock of Tunnel with Small Clear Spacing (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Analytic Hierarchy Process; Fuzzy Comprehensive Evaluation; tunnel with
   small clear spacing; surrounding rock; stability
AB The stability evaluation of the surrounding rock of tunnel with small clear spacing is an important step in a tunnel construction process. In this paper an indicator system was proposed to evaluate the stability state of the central rock pillar between twin tunnel with small clear spacings; then an AHP (Analytic Hierarchy Process) model was constructed to calculate the weights of indicators; and finally, with fuzzy mathematic method, a fuzzy comprehensive evaluation model was set up to evaluate the stability state of the central rock pillar between twin tunnel with small clear spacings. Project cases showed that this method is practical and effective. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: The design of real-time oil spill monitoring system for
   inland waterway based on AIS navigation marks (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE inland waterways; ships; oil spills; monitoring; online system;
   navigation marks; automatic identification system; information fusion
AB In case of ship oil spill accidents, the oil will spread quickly if it is not detected and monitored in time. The later the oil is detected, the more harmful it will be and the more difficult to identify the accident ship. A real-time oil spill monitoring system for inland waterway is designed, which is based on navigation marks with the transponders of marine automatic identification system, and is developed by integrating the oil spill monitoring sensor ID-227, GPS and the sensors of temperature, water flow velocity, wind velocity, wind direction, and visibility. The network communications of marine automatic identification system is used to transmit data from the above sensors to marine accident control center, and information fusion technology is used to process the data. Finally, a framework for developing expert system to support decision-making during oil spill emergency is proposed based on the above oil spill on-line monitoring system. The system can be used for real-time online monitor of oil spills in inland waterways under all weather conditions. It is also helpful to search the accident ship by amalgamated the information from marine automatic identification system and oil spill monitoring system. The weather and hydrologic information at the point of accident from the system can be used to forecast the diffusion trend of the oil. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Yin, Qizhi; Yan, Xinping; Chu, Xiumin; Sun, Xing; Chen, Yiqi] Wuhan Univ Technol, Minist Educ, Engn Res Ctr Transportat Safety, Y125 Mailbox,Yujiatou Campus,1040 HePing Ave, Wuhan, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Degradation of Chemical Industry Integrated Wastewater by

   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Fenton's pre-oxidation process; Activate DEASP; COD removal;
   Biodegradability; Chemical integrated wastewater
AB A two stage sequential Fenton's Pre-oxidation followed by aerobic biological treatment train was used to achieve mineralization of refractory organics and enhance biodegradability of chemical industry integrated wastewater. In the first stage, Fenton's Pre-oxidation process was used while in the second stage activate diatomaceous earth (DE) activated sludge process (ASP) was used as biochemical treatment process. The parameters influencing the COD removal of the wastewater, reaction time, ferrous ion concentrations and molar ratio hydrogen peroxide to ferrous ion R, the initial pH have been optimized to achieve a COD reduction of 60.2% by single factor analysis method. Meanwhile the biodegradability BOD/COD (B/C) value of wastewater was studied which significant improvement was observed initial wastewater B/C value of 0.143 increased to 0.35. It was beneficial to sequential biological treatment after Fenton's Pre-oxidation. In the second stage, activate DEASP shows a mild positive effect on COD removal which further increased to 88%. Simultaneously, analysis organism from wastewater and effluent of the two stages by GC/MS. The results showed that: Fenton's reaction can be considered a suitable pre-treatment which followed by aerobic biological treatment sequence have proved to viable technique for this type of chemical integrated wastewater. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Study on the Semantic Annotation Approach for Professional
   Documents Based on Domain Ontology Partition (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE domain ontology; semantic context; syntax context; semantic annotation
AB This paper researches semantic annotation for professional documents on the web by using existed domain ontologies, and then proposes a semantic annotation approach for professional documents based on domain ontology partition. Firstly, we divide the domain ontology according to certain rules to form some domain ontology segments, and then, choose the most similar domain ontology segment(s) via calculating the semantic similarity between professional documents and domain ontology segments. Finally, professional documents are annotated by the segments. The experimental results show that the approach we have proposed improves both efficiency and accuracy. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Water Competition and Yield of Fruit-crop Intercropping
   System in the Loess Plateau of West Shanxi (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE the Loess Plateau of west Shanxi; fruit-crop intercropping system;
   competition; soil mositure
ID HYDRAULIC LIFT; TREES; INTERFACE
AB Agroforestry is the most effective way to restore the disturbed lands on the Loess Plateau and to develop the poor local economy. Targeting four typical fruit-crop intercropping patterns, i.e. walnut-peanut, walnut-soybean, apple-peanut and apple-soybean in the Loess Plateau of west Shanxi as test objects, soil moisture, yield, land use efficiency and economic benefits of fruit-crop intercropping were studied. The results showed that: (1) Soil moisture and yield of individual peanut or soybean plants were significantly decreased, with the effects increased with decreasing distance from tree row. (2) The results of inter-effect of agroforestry system showed that there were competition for soil moisture between tree and crop in fruit-crop intercropping system. The competition was the weakest for crop and walnut, and the strongest for crop and apple. (3) Based on the comprehensive analysis and comparison, the land use efficiency and economic benefits of fruit-crop intercropping were increased by 70% and 14%, and they were more applicable for popularization in the Loess Plateau of west Shanxi. (4) In order to decrease soil moisture competition between tree and crop in fruit-crop intercropping system, the following measures should be taken: (1) Enhancing the management of irrigation and fertilization for intercropping system. (2) Increasing the distance of crop from tree row, and (3) Setting root barrier between crop and tree. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Yun Lei; Bi Huaxing; Zhu Qingke; Tian Xiaoling; Cui Zhewei; Zhou Huizi; Gao Lubo] Beijing Forestry Univ, Coll Soil & Water Conservat, 35 E Qinghua Rd, Beijing 100083, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: "An Algorithm of Complement Mining Frequent Neighboring Class
   Set" (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE complementary mining; complement set; down-up search; neighboring class
   weight; spatial data mining
AB In frequent neighboring class set mining, when generating candidate frequent itemset, present algorithms have some redundant candidate and repetitive computing, and so this paper proposes an algorithm of complementary mining frequent neighboring class set, which is suitable for mining any frequent neighboring class set. This algorithm adopts double search strategies to generate candidate frequent neighboring class set in the mining course. One is using down-up search strategy to generate candidate, namely, it connects two k-frequent neighboring class sets to generate (k+1)-candidate frequent neighboring class set. The other is computing complement set of (k+1)-candidate to generate next candidate frequent neighboring class set. By the two ways, the algorithm may delete redundant candidate and repetitive computing. The algorithm creates digital database of neighboring class set via neighboring class weight, according to character of database, it also uses digit logical operation to computes support. The result of experiment indicates that the algorithm is faster and more efficient than present algorithms when mining frequent neighboring class set in large spatial data. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Zeng, Ping; Fang, Gang] Chongqing Three Gorges Univ, Chongqing 404000, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: A Method Based on Moment Invariants and Sparse Representation
   for 3D Face Recognition (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE moment invariants; sparse representation; 3-D face recognition; NPU3D
   face database
AB This paper presents a moment invariants based three-dimensional face recognition method under sparse representation framework. An improved moment invariants descriptor is constructed and the discriminative ability in face recognition is validated on NPU3D and FRAV database. A series of partial faces are obtained by segmenting each face model according to the geodesic distance from nose middle point. Proposed moments invariants is computed and stacked as the feature of each face model. Finally, sparse representation is used in the classification step. The result on GavabDB shows that this method is very promising compared with ICP baseline. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Performance of Solid Organic Carbon Sources for in-situ
   Biological Denitrification in Groundwater (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Groundwater; Nitrate; Sawdust; Wheatstraw; Biological denitrification
ID DRINKING-WATER; NITRATE
AB As the lack of carbon source is a key problem of in-situ denitrification in groundwater, choosing appropriate solid carbon source materials is very important. In this study, wheatstraw and sawdust were selected as potential carbon sources to evaluate the performance for in-situ biological denitrification in groundwater by three laboratory-scale column experiments operated at a flow rate of 2.0cm(3)/min for 78 d. The results showed that sawdust was a suitable carbon source with less release of nitrogen compounds and relatively stable release of organic carbon and was applicable for further use as a filling material in in-situ groundwater bioremediation. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Zhang, Jianmei; Feng, Chuanping; Hong, Siqi] China Univ Geosci, Sch Water Resources & Environm, Beijing 100083, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: How Node Mobility Impacts Reactive Ad Hoc Routing Protocols
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE ad hoc networks; reactive routing protocols; node mobility; energy
   consumption
AB To explore how the mobility of the nodes in different ad hoc network scenarios impacts the multi-hop transmission performance of some prominent on-demand pouting protocols like DSR or AODV, a static model and a mobile model for simulating different scenarios of ad hoc networks are proposed. Different criteria for assessing the multi-hop transmission performance of the protocols are also designed and evaluated in a simulation platform based on programming in NS-2. The simulation result shows that in a static ad hoc network AODV has better route discovery performance and consumes less energy for multi-hop data transmission than DSR. In a mobile ad hoc network when the nodes moves slow or when the nodes moves fast within a small network area, AODV and DSR both support a good performance of multi-hop data transmission in terms of the end to end delay, the packet delivery rate, and the energy consumption. However, when the network area becomes larger, the multi-hop transmission performance of AODV and DSR degrades greatly with the increase of the node mobility. The simulation also proves that AODV has a better data transmission performance and is more fit for the scenario with a high node mobility than DSR. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Output-feedback Stabilization of Discrete-time Systems with
   Multiple Time-varying Delays (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE multiple delays; linear matrix inequality (LMI); out-feedback
   stabilization; Lyapunov function
ID H-INFINITY CONTROL; STABILITY-CRITERIA; STATE DELAYS
AB This paper is concerned with the problem of out-feedback stabilization for a class of discrete-time systems with multiple time-varying delays. All the time delays are assumed to be time-varying and bounded. An improved delay-dependent stability condition for the unforced system is proposed in terms of linear matrix inequality (LMI). Then, based on the obtained result, a delay-dependent result for the existence of a static output-feedback controller, which ensures the asymptotical stability of the system with controlled input and multiple delays, is derived. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Instantaneous frequency rate estimation of multi-component
   LMF signals based on LPFT (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE multi-component linear frequency-modulated (LMF) signals; Instantaneous
   frequency rate; Local polynomial Fourier transform (LPFT)
ID TRANSFORM
AB For the problem of the instantaneous frequency rate estimation of multi-component linear frequency-modulated (LMF) signals, a new method is presented. And the local polynomial Fourier transform (LPFT) method is applied to estimate instantaneous frequency rate of multi-component LMF signals. By means of doing local polynomial Fourier transform on multi-component LMF signals, we can separate each LMF signal, and then search the value to find the corresponding frequency rate according to the local polynomial of the every LMF signal, so we accurately estimate the instantaneous frequency rate of the multi-component LMF signal. The simulation results verify the availability of the proposed method. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Stability of impulsive fuzzy BAM neural networks with hybrid
   delays (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Fuzzy BAM neural networks; Equilibrium point; Globally exponential
   stability; Hybrid delays; Impulse
ID BIDIRECTIONAL ASSOCIATIVE MEMORY; TIME-VARYING DELAYS; EXPONENTIAL
   STABILITY; PERIODIC-SOLUTIONS; GLOBAL STABILITY
AB In this paper, impulsive fuzzy bi-directional associative memory (BAM) neural networks with both distributed delays and time-varying delays are considered. Constructing a vector Lyapunov function, applying M-matrix theory and differential inequality techniques, some sufficient conditions are obtained to ensure the existence, uniqueness and global exponential stability of equilibrium point for the addressed neural network. The results generalize and complete previous known results. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: SQL Optimization Based on Oracle Database (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE SQL statement; parse; optimizing performance
AB The problem of database performance has been the focus that decision makers and technicians pay attention to and an important factor that impacts database performance is the low efficiency of the SQL query statements. This paper discusses the execution, parsing procedure and the basic principle of SQL statements and the common reasons why the SQL query statements is low efficiency, and the common steps of optimizing SQL. It also analyses how to optimize the operation of database access and how to improve the query efficiency when several tables connected. Finally, it realizes the optimization of SQL based on oracle database. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Design and Realization of Decision Support System of
   Artillery Radar (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE decision support system; artillery radar; networking; firing calibration
AB To deal with the difficulties in the artillery shooting support by several type radar, such as low automatic transmission level, bad data precision of exploding point and deficient data fusion of exploding point coordinate, a firing calibration evaluation system of networking artillery radar was realized. Basic principle, hardware structure and software structure of the system were discussed. This system is then developed with tools of VC++6.0 and SQLServer. According the principle of Least Squares and weight value of radar precision, the data fusion algorithm of exploding point data based on several networking radar was designed. The shooting results show that the system improves the measure precision of exploding point and automatic command ability.. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Optimal Decision Support System Design for Mass Concrete Dam
   Construction Equipment Matching Scheme (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011

CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)

DE Decision support system; discrete event system simulation; mass concrete
   dam; construction equipment matching scheme
AB The optimal selection of construction equipment matching scheme (CEMS) is the key scientific issue in mass concrete dam construction. In conventional construction organization of water resources and hydropower projects, the CEMS selection relies on manual calculation, which is inconvenient to get the proper scheme. To overcome this problem, a decision support system (DSS) combined expert system and discrete event simulation is proposed in this paper. It can help the construction design staff to determine the proper CEMS and to obtain optimal construction parameters. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Study on fouling of nanofiltration membranes when treating
   reclaimed water (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Nanofiltration membrane; Membrane fouling; Membrane cleaning; reclaimed
ID REVERSE-OSMOSIS MEMBRANE; RO MEMBRANES; PERFORMANCE
AB According to effluent water quality character- ristics of membrane bioreactor (MBR) in the municipal sewage treatment plant, major foulants which causing fouling of nanofiltration membrane elements in subsequent nanofiltration system were analyzed. And based on finding out the major foulants, a suitable cleaning method was determined in this paper. In this paper, determining the fouling level of nanofiltration membrane fouled with the effluent of membrane bioreactor (MBR) based on the change of pressure about nanofiltration system. In order to investigate the fouling reasons and cleaning methods of nanofiltration membrane, SEM and EDX were applied to analyze the membrane fouling layer. The experimental results showed that, the pressure of nanofiltration system was increased 30% after 90 days running. And the result of SEM-EDX about membrane showed that, the major foulants of membrane include organic substances and silicon dioxide. And there may be some inorganic substances, which contained magnesium (Mg) and calcium (Ca). Thought cleaning experiments with HCl, NaOH, STPP (Sodium tripolyphosphate, Na5P3O10) +Na-DDBS (sodium dodecyl benzene sulfonate, C6H5(CH2)(12)SO3Na) about fouled membrane, it was further showed that the foulants of membrane include organic substances, silicon dioxide and some inorganic substances which contained magnesium(Mg) and calcium(Ca). (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

DE the science and technology human resources; support vector machines
   (SVM); the prediction of human resource
AB In this paper, a new method using support vector machines (SVM) for forecasting the demand and supply of science and technology human resources is presented. The results of simulation show that the fitting precision degree of this model is higher than the traditional prediction model, including the trend fitting model, logarithm curve model and the GM(1,1) discrete grey model. The method has advantages of accuracy, convenience, reliability and rapidity. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd.
